title: Unemployment Disruption of benefits due to incorrect verbiage.
question: I received a notice of frozen benefits due to a response supplied by the Temporary Agency I once worked for. When questioned by the EDD as to why I was no longer employed, they have only 2 responses; 1. Found another job; 2. Put on temp to perm position. This unfortunately was not the case and EDD was told I "Quit for another job." Frozen benefits. When I contacted the agency I was given a letter to clarify that because they "the agency" removed me from the payroll systems because I found work (another temporary position) I did NOT quit. Bottom line, due to this small play on words I will be penalized by creditors due to late payments, rent etc. Can I try to claim $ for help repaying past debts bought on by the error?
answers: If you are asking whether you have a meritorious lawsuit against the temporary agency for any damages caused by statements it made to the Employment Development Department in response to an inquiry about the reasons for your separation from employment, the answer is "no" because the communication was privileged under California law.
